other_tests.findings: Pathological examination reportedly showed leukocytoclastic vasculitis and no microorganisms.
Pathological examination revealed a superficial and deep, dense, diffuse neutrophilic infiltrate. Staining for microorganisms was negative, and cultures were sterile.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Partial improvement noted after administration of higher-dose systemic glucocorticoids.

other_tests.date: Six days before admission to this hospital
other_tests.findings: Pathological examination reportedly revealed neutrophilic dermatitis, with a suggestion of follicular perforation and folliculitis; no microorganisms were seen.
Biopsy specimen was normocellular, showed dysplastic megakaryocytes, and revealed frequent dysplastic myeloid cells. Cytogenetic analysis revealed an abnormal, complex karyotype.
Cloudy yellow urine, trace protein, 3+ occult blood, 20 to 50 red cells per high-power field, and 3 to 5 hyaline casts per low-power field.
